column2: DELAWARE DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Delaware
column6: DE

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column6: Danger ahead.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 2. Drivers should allow an extra cushion of space when following:
column4: a passenger car.
column6: drivers whose view to the rear is blocked.
column8: an SUV.

column2: 3. When passing another vehicle, you should return to your lane if:
column4: you have passed the other vehicle’s front bumper.
column6: you can see both headlights in the rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 25 feet in front of the passed vehicle.

column2: 4. Drivers turning left must yield to:
column4: oncoming vehicles turning left.
column6: oncoming vehicles going straight.
column8: None of the above.

column2: 5. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 6. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Leave the road immediately.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.

column2: 7. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly.
column6: slow down.
column8: drive at a constant speed.

column2: 8. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 9. A crosswalk is:
column4: a special type of 4-way intersection.
column6: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.
column8: an area designated for blind persons.

column2: 10. A curb painted red means:
column4: No parking or stopping
column6: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off
column8: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

column2: 11. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
column6: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.
column8: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.

column2: 12. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Interstate highway
column6: Area reserved for people with disabilities
column8: Hospital service

column2: 13. You are approaching an intersection with a traffic signal indicating a steady yellow light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
column4: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: stop before entering the intersection if it is safe to do so.
column8: speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.

column2: 14. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column6: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.
column8: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.

column2: 15. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column4: when your lane is empty.
column6: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.
column8: Under no circumstances.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a sharp turn.
column6: a cross road.
column8: a side road.

column2: 17. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a steering failure.
column6: of a brake failure.
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 18. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column4: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.
column6: change lanes abruptly.
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 19. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column8: exclusively for stop signs.

column2: 20. When driving at night, drivers should:
column4: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.
column6: increase their following distance.
column8: always use their high beams.

column2: 21. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.
column6: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column8: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.

column2: 22. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Brake early and gently.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 23. When being passed by another vehicle, drivers should:
column4: slow down.
column6: slightly increase their speed.
column8: maintain a constant speed.

column2: 24. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Low ground clearance railroad crossing
column6: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)
column8: Parallel railroad crossing (side road)

column2: 25. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Suggestions
column6: Law
column8: Warnings

column2: 26. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 27. If a bus needs to make a right turn and you are also turning right:
column4: squeeze between the bus and the curb.
column6: wait until the bus turns before turning right.
column8: try to turn right before the bus does.

column2: 28. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 29. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 30. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column6: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column8: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
